docs.summary: Manages BackInStockNotificationRequests - requests for notification about items, that were out of stock previously and now back in stock again.

operations.name: Create Back In Stock Notification Request

params.name: request
params.doc: Notification request data (id is ignored, as it's generated by server)

params.name: itemDetails
params.doc: Item data used in email and chat notifications

docs.summary:
Create a BackInStockNotificationRequest. May not create new entry if there is existing non resolved request
 for same CatalogReference and email (will return existing request in response)

operations.name: Delete Back In Stock Notification Request
Get Back In Stock Notification Request
Get Back In Stock Notification Requests Count By Catalog References

params.name: catalogReferences
params.doc: Back in stock requests to be counted identified by their CatalogReference.

docs.summary: Returns the number of BackInStockNotificationRequests for a given CatalogReferences.
Provides settings of given BackInStock TPA instance.

operations.name: Query Back In Stock Notification Requests

docs.summary: Returns BackInStockNotificationRequests matching given search parameters

params.name: catalogReference
params.doc:
Item identifier. All BackInStockNotificationRequests for this item identifier will be processed.
 Cannot be used with `request_ids`.

params.name: requestIds
params.doc:
Identifiers of BackInStockNotificationRequest that need to be handled.
 Cannot be used with `catalog_reference`.

params.name: itemDetails
params.doc:
Item data used in email and chat notifications.
 Item details values will also be passed into automation template which is used for actual back in stock notification to User of User
 (item_details.price will be passed as `item.price`, item_details.name - as `item.name`, item_details.image.url as `item.image.url`
 In case when automation template contains only [`item.price`, `item.name`, `item.image.url`] placeholders,
 `extra_automation_template_parameters` may be left empty
 In case when automation template is defined without using [`item.price`, `item.name`, `item.image.url`] placeholders,
 values should be passed in `extra_automation_template_parameters`

params.name: extraAutomationTemplateParameters
params.doc:
Set of key-value pairs. Extra key-value pairs that will be passed to back in stock notification email template
 [`item.price`, `item.name`, `item.image.url`] placeholder values that are taken from item_details field may be overridden by values from this map

docs.summary:
Will handle all BackInStockNotificationRequests referencing given item (if `catalog_reference` parameter is present)
 Otherwise (if `request_ids` parameter present) will handle BackInStockNotificationRequests with given ids

params.name: appId
params.doc: Catalog appDefId whose products should be referenced by BackInStockNotificationRequest

docs.summary:
Enables BackInStockNotificationRequest collection for all products of given catalog (StartCollectingRequestsRequest.app_id).
 BackInStockNotificationRequestService.CreateBackInStockNotificationRequest will throw errors when given BackInStockNotificationRequest
 for item from catalog which does not collect requests.

params.name: appId
params.doc: Catalog appDefId whose products shouldn't be referenced by BackInStockNotificationRequest

docs.summary:
Disables BackInStockNotificationRequest collection for all products of given catalog (StartCollectingRequestsRequest.app_id)
 BackInStockNotificationRequestService.CreateBackInStockNotificationRequest will throw errors when given BackInStockNotificationRequest
 for item from catalog which does not collect requests.

members.name: price

members.name: image
members.doc: Item image

members.name: kind
members.doc: The kind of value.

members.name: nullValue
members.doc: Represents a null value.

members.name: numberValue
members.doc: Represents a double value.

members.name: stringValue
members.doc: Represents a string value.

members.name: boolValue
members.doc: Represents a boolean value.

members.name: structValue
members.doc: Represents a structured value.

members.doc: Represents a repeated `Value`.

docs.summary: Used for grouping line items and is sent on add to cart

members.name: catalogItemId
members.doc: ID of the item within its Wix or 3rd-party catalog. For example, `productId` for Wix Stores or `bookingId` for Wix Bookings.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the catalog app. For items from Wix apps, the following values always apply:
+ Wix Stores: `"215238eb-22a5-4c36-9e7b-e7c08025e04e"`
+ Wix Bookings: `"13d21c63-b5ec-5912-8397-c3a5ddb27a97"`

members.name: options
members.doc:
Additional info in key:value form. For example, to specify Wix Stores product options or variants:
+ `{"options": {"options": {"Size": "M", "Color": "Red"}}}`
+ `{"options": {"variantId": "<VARIANT_ID>"}}`

messages.name: _com_wixpress_ecom_back_in_stock_BackInStockNotificationRequest
messages.displayName: Back In Stock Notification Request Object

members.name: id
members.doc: Request id (autogenerated upon creation)

members.name: catalogReference
members.doc: Item identifier

members.name: email
members.doc: Email that will receive notification about item being back in stock

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact id (autogenerated upon creation) which is associated with given email. Will receive all notifications

members.name: status
members.doc: Request status

members.name: autoNotified
members.doc: Describes how notification was made: automatically or manually by store owner

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Order creation date and time.

members.name: itemUrl
members.doc: override default item url returned from the implementer

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: count
members.doc: The number of items returned in this response.

members.name: offset
members.doc: The offset which was requested. Returned if offset paging was used.

members.name: total
members.doc: The total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging was used.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through result pages. Returned if cursor paging was used.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: filter
members.doc: Filter object.

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sorting options. For example, `[{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Cannot be used together with `cursorPaging`.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Cannot be used together with `paging`. `cursorPaging.cursor` can not be used together with `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
 This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
 We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
 Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
 This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
 Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
 Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
 For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
 NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
 For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
  it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
 As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
 To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
  message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

docs.summary:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

Possible values are:
  • UNSPECIFIED
  • RECEIVED - initial status of all new requests
  • PROCESSING
  • NOTIFICATION_SENT
  • FAILED
